questions.question: Main reason to use fractional Kelly (e.g., 0.5x):
options: To reduce sensitivity to estimation error and drawdown volatility
To maximize CAGR at all costs
questions.explanation: Fractional Kelly retains much of growth with lower risk when inputs are uncertain.

questions.question: If full Kelly f*=0.20 and you impose a 40% cap of full Kelly, what is position size?
Give one portfolio-level reason to cut position sizes below Kelly.
questions.answer_text: Cross-asset correlations raise aggregate risk; fractional Kelly limits portfolio volatility.
